definition: to draw (e.g. a bow)/to pull/to stretch sth/to extend/to lengthen/to involve or implicate in/to attract/to lead/to guide/to leave/to provide evidence or justification for/old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])

sentences.english: So some interest group would get involved if you made a fuss.
sentences.chinese: 如果你引逗這些動物的話，一些興趣組織會介入。

sentences.english: The children enticed the kitten from the tree.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們把小貓從樹上引逗下來。

sentences.english: And they prodded into exercising by being forced to jump and jump until they were exhausted.
sentences.chinese: 他們被別人引逗着跳來跳去直到它們筋疲力盡。

definition: to tease/to provoke/to play with (a child, animal etc)
to provoke/to entice/to lure/to tantalize/to tease/to titillate
to tease/to make fun of/to provoke/to stir up (trouble)
to stay/to stop/to tease (play with)/amusing/short pause in reading aloud, equivalent to comma (also written 讀|读[dou4])
to nod one's head and wag one's tail (idiom)/to be well pleased with oneself/to have a lighthearted air
to hook onto/to hitch onto/to catch onto
